meanings.definition: Wuses (noun): plural form of wus, meaning a person who is timid or easily scared.
meanings.sent1: In the haunted house, the group of wuses screamed at every little noise.
meanings.sent2: The wuses in the movie hid behind their hands during the scary scenes.
meanings.sent3: The wuses at the campfire jumped at the sound of a twig snapping.
meanings.sent4: The wuses in the dark mistook a shadow for a ghost.
meanings.sent5: The wuses' fear of spiders was so intense that they refused to enter the old shed.

meanings.definition: Wuses (verb): third person singular present of wus, meaning to act timidly or show fear.
meanings.sent1: She wuses whenever she hears thunder outside.
meanings.sent2: The puppy wuses when it sees a big dog approaching.
meanings.sent3: He wuses around bees, afraid of getting stung.
meanings.sent4: The child wuses before going on stage for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The cat wuses at the sight of a cucumber on the floor.

meanings.definition: Wuses (adjective): comparative form of wus, meaning more timid or scared than others.
meanings.sent1: The wuses kitten hid under the bed during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: She felt wuses after watching a scary movie alone.
meanings.sent3: The wuses puppy refused to go near the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The wuses child clung to their parent's leg in the unfamiliar environment.
meanings.sent5: The wuses student hesitated to raise their hand in class.
